metaDescription: Find top-rated financial advisors in Milwaukee. Expert guidance for retirement planning, wealth management, and investment strategies.

advisors.name: Edward Jones - Financial Advisor: Colin J Dewey, ABFP®|CRPC™

heroDescription: Milwaukee, Wisconsin, is a vibrant city known for its rich cultural heritage and diverse economy.
landscapeDescription: Milwaukee's economy is anchored by manufacturing, healthcare, and finance. The city is experiencing steady growth, attracting new businesses and residents.
uniqueNeeds: Milwaukee requires focus on economic diversification and housing stability to support its growing population.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Milwaukee's manufacturing focus poses risks; diversify into tech and services. Housing market shows signs of volatility; prepare for potential flooding and economic shifts.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Milwaukee's GDP growth rate is projected at 2.5%, driven by healthcare and manufacturing sectors.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median household income in Milwaukee is approximately $60,000, reflecting a diverse economic base.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Milwaukee are increasingly focusing on retirement planning and investment strategies.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Milwaukee's cost of living is 10% lower than the national average, making it an attractive place to live.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), Milwaukee's real estate market shows a 5% annual increase, with concerns about affordability for first-time buyers.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Milwaukee ranks high for small business growth, supported by local initiatives and access to funding.
